photo.description: Detail of the Fountain of Neptune in Bologna, created by Giambologna. From Wikipedia: "Pope Pius IV gave Giambologna his first major commission, the colossal bronze Neptune and subsidiary figures for the Fountain of Neptune (the base designed by Tommaso Laureti, 1566) in Bologna."

photo.description: The Fountain of Neptune (Fontana di Nettuno) is a monumental civic fountain located in the eponymous square, Piazza Nettuno, next to Piazza Maggiore, in Bologna, Italy[1] Its bronze figure of Neptune, extending his reach in a lordly gesture of stilling and controlling the waters, is an early work of Giambologna's maturity, completed about 1567.[2] An innovation of Giambologna's fountain designs is the fantastic and non-geometrical forms he gave to the basins into which water splashed and flowed, "curiously folded, bulging and elastic in form", as Rosalind Grippi remarked.[3] The fountain is a model example of Mannerist taste of the courtly elite in the mid-sixteenth century: construction of the statue was commissioned by the Cardinal Legate of the city, Charles Borromeo, to symbolize the fortunate recent election of Borromeo's uncle as Pope Pius IV. Detail with a lactating nereid. The work was designed by the Palermitan architect Tommaso Laureti in 1563, with an over-lifesize bronze of the god Neptune on the top, executed by Giambologna, who had submitted a model for the fountain of Neptune in Florence, but had lost the commission to Baccio Bandinelli. Before the fountain was built, an entire edifice was demolished to make space for it. The fountain was completed in 1565,[4] and the Neptune was fixed in place within a couple of years. - wiki

photo.description: The sculptor of the statue, Giambologna, carved a Neptune that was rather.. well endowed. The Pope at the time was not thrilled by this, and ordered him to change it. Well Giambologna did, but managed to get around this by using an interesting angle: if you stand just in the right spot, the outstretched finger of Neptune appears to be his erect penis. Unfortunately, the shots I took from that angle didn't come out very well.

photo.description: The "Fontana del Nettuno" (Neptune Fountain) in piazza del Nettuno, Bologna. The work was designed by the Palermitan architect Tommaso Laureti in 1563, with an over-lifesize bronze of the God Neptune on the top, executed by Giambologna, who had submitted a model for the similar fountain of Neptune in Florence, but had lost the commision to Baccio Bandinelli. Before the fountain was built, an entire edifice was demolished to make space for it. The fountain was completed in 1565,[5] and the Neptune was fixed in place within a couple of years. (wikipedia)

photo.description: Livre La Bourgogne vue du ciel n°2 de Laurent et Gérard CORRET www.eurociel.com page 118 La cour d'entrée, encadrée par d'importants communs, est composée de carrés et de losanges de buis plantés de lavandes, de rosiers roses et blancs. Les jardins à la française sont constitués de terrasses. Sur la première, un jardin de buis de 2300 m², est orné d'une dentelle de 25000 pieds régulièrement taillés. Une paire de bronze représentant Diane et Apollon encadre cette terrasse. En contrebas, le jardin des topiaires est organisé sur un tracé géométrique axé sur la fontaine aux Ammanatti, décorée de naïades de Jean de Bologne. Ces dernières avaient été réalisées pour la fontaine de Neptune à Florence. Autour de cette fontaine, des ifs sont taillés en « carafes ». La perspective se prolonge dans le parc, au-delà du haha (petit mur de pierre), vers un grand bassin qui parachève la composition. De là, la promenade mène à une petite folie, la « tour des demoiselles ». Près de la serre, le jardin sud, dominant le bocage du Charolais-Brionnais, est occupé par une roseraie (riche de 1300 rosiers dans les tons pastels) à laquelle on accède par une promenade bordée de rosiers sur tige. De forme elliptique, cette roseraie est centrée sur un ancien bassin d'arrosage en forme de poisson qui est orné de jets d'eau et de « putti » que l'on doit à Jean de Bologne. - The court(yard) of entrance(entry), framed(supervised) by important outbuildings, consists of squares and standing rhombuses of box tree of lavenders, of pink and white rosebushes. Formal gardens are established(constituted) by terraces. On the first one(night), a garden of box tree of 2300 m ², is decorated with a 25000 foot lace regularly cut. A bronze pair representing Diane and Apollo frames(supervises) this terrace. Below, the garden of the topiary is organized on a geometrical plan centred on the fountain in Ammanatti, decorated with naiads of Jean of Bologna. These last ones had been realized for the fountain of Neptune in Florence. Around this fountain, yews are cut in "decanters". The prospect(perspective) goes on in the park, beyond the haha ( small stony wall), towards a big pond which completes the composition. From there, the walk leads to a small madness, the " tour(tower,ballot) of the young ladies ". Near the greenhouse, the south garden, dominating the bocage of Charolais-Brionnais, is occupied by a rose garden.
photo.tags: saône et loire 71 bourgognechâteau lavande rosier jardin française terrasse buis bronze géométrique fontaine ammanatti naîade jean de bologne neptune florence carafe bassin demoiselle charollais brionnais roseraie poisson putti vol5889
